channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- Fence Agents Remediation 0.4 for RHEL 8
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- Fence Agents Remediation 0.4 for RHEL 8

item.title: CVE-2024-5651|2024-08-30T13:45:15.074Z -- red%20hat -- fence%20agents%20remediation%200.4%20for%20rhel%208
item.description: A flaw was found in the Fence Agents Remediation operator. This vulnerability can allow a Remote Code Execution (RCE) primitive by supplying an arbitrary command to execute in the --ssh-path/--telnet-path arguments. A low-privilege user, for example, a user with developer access, can create a specially crafted FenceAgentsRemediation for a fence agent supporting --ssh-path/--telnet-path arguments to execute arbitrary commands on the operator's pod. This RCE leads to a privilege escalation, first as the service account running the operator, then to another service account with cluster-admin privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-5651|2024-08-19T16:45:08.177Z -- red%20hat -- fence%20agents%20remediation%200.4%20for%20rhel%208
item.description: A flaw was found in fence agents that rely on SSH/Telnet. This vulnerability can allow a Remote Code Execution (RCE) primitive by supplying an arbitrary command to execute in the --ssh-path/--telnet-path arguments. A low-privilege user, for example, a user with developer access, can create a specially crafted FenceAgentsRemediation for a fence agent supporting --ssh-path/--telnet-path arguments to execute arbitrary commands on the operator's pod. This RCE leads to a privilege escalation, first as the service account running the operator, then to another service account with cluster-admin privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-5651|2024-08-20T19:48:29.407Z -- red%20hat -- fence%20agents%20remediation%200.4%20for%20rhel%208
item.description: A flaw was found in fence agents that rely on SSH/Telnet. A low-privilege user, for example, a user with developer access, can create a specially crafted FenceAgentsRemediation for a fence agent supporting --ssh-path/--telnet-path arguments to execute arbitrary commands on the operator's pod. This RCE leads to a privilege escalation, first as the service account running the operator, then to another service account with cluster-admin privileges.
